intro: Stenotus armerioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf armeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features upright, branched stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink or white flowers bloom in clusters at the tips of the stems, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stenotus armerioides is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
